0.title: Will push for 5 minors to be tried as adults in Hyd rape case: Police
0.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand has said that the police will push for the five minors arrested in the Hyderabad gang-rape case to be treated as adults "for maximum punishment". This is permitted after a 2015 amendment to the Juvenile Justice Act for those aged 16-18 accused of a "heinous offence". Of the six accused arrested, only one is major.

1.title: 6 women labourers injured in lightning strikes in Assam's Biswanath
1.article_body: At least six women labourers were injured after lightning struck them in Assam's Biswanath district on Wednesday. The women were tea garden labourers and were plucking leaves in the garden when the lightning struck them. They are undergoing treatment at a hospital. In April this year, 18 people died due to lightning and storms in Assam.

2.title: Government's response on Prophet remark row not enough: Hamid Ansari
2.article_body: The government's response on the Prophet remark row is "not enough", former Vice-President Mohammad Hamid Ansari said. "This should have been dealt with at an appropriate political level...PM Modi could have diffused it...no one thought it fit to do this at an appropriate time," he added. Over 15 Islamic nations condemned former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

3.title: Country faced embarrassment due to BJP: CM Thackeray on Prophet remark row
3.article_body: While addressing a public rally in Aurangabad, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the country faced embarrassment due to BJP over the remarks made by their now-suspended spokesperson Nupur Sharma against Prophet Muhammad. "We had to kneel in front of the Middle East countries...Why should the country apologise when BJP is responsible for this incident?" Thackeray said.

4.title: Muslim fakirs threatened in UP, made to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'
4.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, three Muslim fakirs (religious men) can be seen being threatened by some locals. The incident reportedly happened in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda. In the video, a man can be seen slapping one of the fakirs and making them apologise. The man can also be seen asking the fakirs to chant 'Jai Shri Ram'.

5.title: NCP names Eknath Khadse for Maharashtra Legislative Council polls
5.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday named Eknath Khadse for the upcoming elections to 10 seats of the Maharashtra Legislative Council. Khadse, who is facing an Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe in the MIDC land deal, had quit BJP in October 2020. "The BJP ignored me but NCP chief Sharad Pawar has shown confidence in me," Khadse said.

6.title: I'm doing much better: Nick Jonas on his softball injury
6.article_body: Singer-actor Nick Jonas, speaking about his softball injury, said he's doing much better. This comes after a video of Nick limping into an emergency room in California went viral on social media. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user wrote, "It is so wrong to film this......hope he's okay!" Nick replied, "Yeah it is for sure...but I'm doing much better!"

7.title: JD(S) shifts MLAs to Bengaluru resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
7.article_body: In a bid to avoid poaching ahead of Rajya Sabha elections, Janata Dal (Secular) has shifted its MLAs to a resort in Bengaluru. "It is a routine practice as we will have a JDLP [JDS Legislature Party] meeting this [Thursday] evening and people [legislators] who have come from different places will stay back there," said JD(S) leader BM Farooq.

8.title: Fire near Shah Masjid in Delhi, 7 fire tenders rushed; 20 people rescued
8.article_body: A fire broke out near Shah Masjid, Batla House in the Jamia Nagar area of Delhi, news agency ANI reported. According to the Delhi Fire Service, seven fire tenders were rushed to the fire site. Delhi Fire Service also added that 20 people have been rescued so far and that the fire is under control.

9.title: Bihar CM’s good governance claim intact: Kishor as parents beg for son's body
9.article_body: After the parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from a hospital, political strategist Prashant Kishor said humanity is ashamed. "Yet, Nitish Kumar’s claim of good governance is intact," Kishor tweeted. A hospital employee allegedly asked the parents for ₹50,000 to release the body.

10.title: Mumbai record biggest-ever victory in history of first-class cricket
10.article_body: Mumbai defeated Uttarakhand by 725 runs in Ranji Trophy 2021-22 quarter-final to record the biggest-ever victory (by runs) in the history of first-class cricket. The previous biggest victory (by runs) in first-class cricket was recorded in January 1930, when New South Wales defeated Queensland by 685 runs. Mumbai will now face Uttar Pradesh in the semi-final.

11.title: Delhi records 500+ COVID cases after 18 days, highest in 24 days
11.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday recorded over 500 fresh COVID-19 cases after a span of 18 days. With 564 new COVID-19 cases, the tally is highest in 24 days. Reports said that the positivity rate stood at 2.84 per cent on Wednesday. "There are likely to be such...ups and downs in cases throughout year...there is no need to panic," a doctor said.

12.title: Have seen days when I walked into producers' room, my phone was broken: Anud
12.article_body: Actor Anud Singh Dhaka, who will be seen in 'Janhit Mein Jaari', said that he has said no to work and money in the past. "I have seen days when I had to walk into the room of producers or influential people, and my phone was broken...I don't have producers queuing up behind me," he added.

13.title: 7 killed, 41 injured in suspected arson in South Korea building
13.article_body: At least seven people were killed and 41 others injured after a fire, which resulted from suspected arson, broke out in a seven-floor office building in South Korea's Daegu city. The police said that in the security camera footage, the suspect was seen leaving his home holding an apparent container that may have been used for arson.

14.title: Russian mountaineer unfurls Ukraine flag on Mt Everest in protest against war
14.article_body: A Russian mountaineer and blogger unfurled the Ukrainian flag on top of world's highest peak, Mount Everest, in protest against her country's war in Ukraine. Katya Lipka shared the picture of the moment on Instagram on June 3. Lipka achieved the feat on May 24, three months after Russia invaded Ukraine.

15.title: Used to live in a house as big as a carpet in my current home: Farah
15.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan said she used to live in a house which was as big as a certain carpet in her current residence. "Our fridge had conked off for years...We used to take a tapeli of water and give it to...our neighbour. She...[would] keep it in the fridge. It would turn into ice and then we'd break it," added Farah.

16.title: Thailand decriminalises marijuana, govt says for medical use only
16.article_body: Thailand became the first Asian country to decriminalise cultivation and possession of marijuana on Thursday. The government is promoting cannabis for medical use. Speaking in favour of cannabis recently, Health Minister Anutin Charnvirakul had said, "We should know how to use cannabis." "If we have the right awareness, cannabis is like gold, something valuable and should be promoted," he added.

17.title: 6, including 2 women, held for assaulting traffic personnel in Delhi
17.article_body: At least six persons, including two women, were arrested for allegedly assaulting a traffic police personnel in Delhi's Tigri, police said. The incident took place when the traffic personnel was issuing challan to a man for triple riding when he and his sisters allegedly attacked him. One of the women claimed that the inspector slapped her.

18.title: Tesla proceeds with online hiring event in China, adds new job postings
18.article_body: Tesla will be holding an online hiring event in China today and has added two dozen new job postings for the country. It'll be recruiting staff for "smart manufacturing" roles. The firm currently has 224 openings for managers and engineers under that category. This comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the firm needs to cut staff by around 10%.

19.title: Sri Lanka hit by power cuts after key union goes on strike
19.article_body: Many parts of Sri Lanka were hit by power cuts on Thursday after a power sector union went on an indefinite strike. The union is opposing the government's plan to amend legislation governing the nation's power sector, including removing curbs on competitive bidding for renewable power projects. On Wednesday, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa declared electricity supply an essential service.

20.title: K'taka teacher shares private photos of girl student on WhatsApp; booked
20.article_body: A 44-year-old physical education teacher in Karnataka has been booked for allegedly sharing private pictures of a girl student on WhatsApp. The accused reportedly exploited the girl sexually after promising her that he would marry her. He also took pictures of their private moments and shared them on WhatsApp status after her family fixed her marriage with another person.

21.title: India's bio-economy has grown 8 times in last 8 years: PM
21.article_body: India's bio-economy has grown eight times in the last eight years, PM Narendra Modi said on Thursday. "India is not too far from joining the league of top ten countries in the biotech global ecosystem," he added. Furthermore, he said that more than 5,000 start-ups are associated with the biotech sector.

22.title: Rafael Nadal has been living with pain since 2005: Ex-coach Toni
22.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said Rafael has been living with pain since the last 17 years. "If there is a shred of hope...he keeps trying. That's his sporting greatness," added Toni. "It is incredible that my limping nephew continues to win. Fighting to the end is in his DNA," stated Toni. Rafael recently won French Open 2022.

23.title: 11-yr-old B'luru boy kidnapped for ₹50 lakh ransom rescued within 9 hours
23.article_body: Bengaluru Police rescued an 11-year-old boy kidnapped for a ransom of ₹50 lakh within nine hours. The son of a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation driver Subhash was kidnapped from outside his home in Horamavu at around 5.30 pm on Tuesday by an unknown woman. He was held captive at a farmhouse, where the woman's brother-in-law worked as a security guard.

24.title: Sickness is getting worse: Justin Bieber after postponing tour dates
24.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber has postponed the dates of his upcoming North American Justice tour. "Can't believe I'm saying this. I've done everything to get better, but my sickness is getting worse," Justin wrote on his Instagram Stories. The tour was scheduled to begin on June 7 at Scotiabank Arena in Toronto. "I'm gonna rest and get better," he concluded.

25.title: 3 arrested for murdering 22-yr-old grocery shop owner in Gurugram
25.article_body: Police arrested three people for allegedly murdering a 22-year-old grocery shop owner on Gurugram's Kundli-Manesar-Palwal Expressway after stealing his valuables on Wednesday. The accused had been involved in several robberies across Manesar in recent months, police said. The deceased told them to spare his life and take away what they wanted, said his fiancee, who was on call with him.

26.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.81 against US dollar
26.article_body: The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of 77.81 against the US dollar on Thursday. It had recorded the previous all-time low of 77.7975 on May 17. This comes amid sustained foreign capital outflows and elevated global crude oil prices. The Indian rupee had opened at 77.74 at the interbank foreign exchange on Thursday.

27.title: Kangana shares pics of her new mountain-style home in Manali made of river stone
27.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram to share pictures of her new home in Manali. "I built a new home...it’s an extension of my existing house in Manali, but this time kept it authentic, typically mountain style made of river stone, local slates and wood," she wrote. She added, "I've also incorporated Himachali paintings, weaves, rugs, embroideries and wooden karigiri."

28.title: Owaisi, Yati Narsinghanand named in Delhi Police FIR over 'inflammatory remarks'
28.article_body: Delhi Police have named AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks, ANI reported. This comes after Delhi Police registered cases against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit Naveen Kumar Jindal and journalist Saba Naqvi for allegedly spreading hate.

29.title: Sena MP Priyanka to visit J&K to meet deceased Kashmiri pandits' families
29.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi will visit Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday to meet the relatives of Kashmiri Pandits killed recently. She is also expected to meet the family of government employee Rahul Bhat who was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam. Chaturvedi had earlier written to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking security for Hindu community in Kashmir.

30.title: 24-yr-old from Gujarat marries herself ahead of scheduled date; shares pics
30.article_body: Kshama Bindu from Gujarat has married herself ahead of the scheduled date after a BJP leader opposed her wedding and said she wouldn't be allowed to marry in a temple. The 24-year-old, who had said that her parents are open-minded and accepting of her wedding, shared pics from her wedding, mehendi and haldi ceremonies.

31.title: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's ED custody extended till June 13
31.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has got the custody of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain till June 13. He was taken to Rouse Avenue District Court as his ED custody ended on Thursday. The ED  had earlier also raided Jain's residence in connection with the case. Jain was arrested in an alleged money laundering case on May 30.

32.title: South Africa will 100% win 1st T20I vs India if they win toss: Aakash
32.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra said South Africa will 100 percent win the first match of the five-match T20I series against India, if they win the toss. "If India [win] the toss, then also...51-49 [percent] in favour of South Africa," added Aakash. Aakash stated there isn't any bowler in India's team for the series barring Yuzvendra Chahal who troubles Quinton De Kock.

33.title: Govt’s efforts to force peace in J&K failed miserably: Farooq Abdullah
33.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that the government's efforts to "force peace" in Jammu and Kashmir have failed "miserably". "We are facing an alarming situation that has arisen out of the August 5, 2019, undemocratic and unconstitutional decisions," Abdullah added. "Now, they are struggling with their failures. Neither there is peace nor any visage of development here," he stated.

34.title: Poster asking shops to remain shut on June 10 surfaces in Unnao, probe on
34.article_body: Police launched a probe after a poster making an appeal to keep shops closed on June 10, Friday, surfaced in UP’s Unnao district. The poster was put up in the Sadar Kotwali area, ASP, Shashi Shekhar Singh, said. The poster seemed to be the handiwork of some mischievous elements and the police have removed it, the officer added.

35.title: Mexican megachurch leader jailed in US for child sexual abuse
35.article_body: The leader of a Mexico-based megachurch that claims to have around 5 million followers worldwide has been sentenced to 16 years and eight months in a California jail for sexually abusing young girls. Naason Garcia last week had pleaded guilty to two counts of forcible oral copulation involving minors and performing a lewd act on a child.

36.title: 'The Gray Man' is Dhanush's 1st H'wood film, he's fantastic: Joe Russo
36.article_body: ‘The Gray Man’ co-director Anthony Russo has said, “The cast is dynamite in this movie...there’s a lot of places to go other than those two guys [Chris Evans and Ryan Gosling] up front.” When asked if this was Dhanush’s first Hollywood film, Joe Russo replied, “Yes, this is Dhanush’s first Hollywood film. He’s fantastic.”

37.title: What happened to Shah Rukh was witch-hunt for backing TMC: Naseeruddin on Aryan case
37.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah has suggested that Aryan Khan was arrested in a drug case because Shah Rukh Khan supported West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's party. Naseeruddin Shah said, "What happened to Shah Rukh Khan and the dignity with which he faced it was admirable. It was nothing but a witch-hunt. All he did was support Trinamool and applaud Mamata Banerjee's victory."

38.title: 10 more victims of Delhi's Mundka fire tragedy identified
38.article_body: Ten more bodies of Mundka fire victims have been identified by the forensic teams through DNA matching, officials said on Thursday. With this, 20 of the 27 people, who died in the massive fire at a commercial building in Outer Delhi's Mundka, have been identified. The remaining seven bodies are being processed for sample extraction and testing, officials added.

39.title: Dispose of public applications in time-bound manner: UP CM to officials
39.article_body: The Chief Secretary and Director General of Police should ensure that District Magistrates (DMs)/Superintendents of Police (SPs) are sensitive to the disposal of public grievances, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "Public applications should be disposed of in a time-bound manner. DMs and SPs should interact with local public representatives and take guidance from them on public issues," UP CM added.

40.title: Don't know how they explain it to their conscience: Naseeruddin on Khans' silence
40.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah has spoken on the silence of Bollywood's Khans on political matters, saying, "I feel they think they would be risking too much. But then, I don't know how they explain to their own conscience about it." He added, "I cannot speak for them...I'm not in the position they are in." This comes after ex-BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet.

41.title: PM Modi inaugurates India's first Biotech Startup Expo 2022 in Delhi
41.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated India's first Biotech Startup Expo 2022 at Delhi's Pragati Maidan. "It will strengthen the Aatmanirbhar Bharat movement in the sector," he said. "India's bio-economy has grown eight times in the last eight years. India is not too far from joining the league of top ten countries in the biotech global ecosystem," PM Modi added.

42.title: BMC sub-engineer, associate arrested for taking ₹1 lakh as bribe
42.article_body: A BMC sub-engineer and his associate were arrested by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹1 lakh. The sub-engineer, identified as Sacchidanand Kore, had reportedly demanded money through his associate in return for clearing a person's application for water connection to his plot in Malad. Following a complaint, ACB laid a trap and arrested the accused.

43.title: Armed man arrested for threatening to kill US Supreme Court Justice
43.article_body: A 26-year-old man with a pistol and a knife was arrested on Wednesday near US Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh's home after allegedly threatening to kill the judge. Nicholas Roske has been charged with the attempted murder of a Supreme Court Justice. Roske was allegedly upset over Texas school shooting and expected Supreme Court rulings on abortion and gun rights.

44.title: Actress Mahima Chaudhry reveals she had breast cancer, Anupam Kher shares video
44.article_body: In a video shared by actor Anupam Kher, actress Mahima Chaudhry revealed she had breast cancer. She said the cancer was diagnosed during an annual checkup and added she has now recovered from it. "Her attitude will give hope to so many women all over the world...She calls me an eternal optimist but dearest Mahima, 'You're my HERO!'" Anupam wrote.

45.title: Spikes spotted on Mars; NASA releases pic
45.article_body: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration has released a picture of spikes that were spotted by its Curiosity rover on Mars. Sharing the picture on Twitter, the SETI Institute said, "The spikes are most likely the cemented fillings of ancient fractures in a sedimentary rock. The rest of the rock was made of softer material and was eroded away."

46.title: All religions preach humanity: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai
46.article_body: Addressing the farewell for Haj pilgrims, Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said all religions preach humanity and appealed to them to pray for peace in the country. "One who completes Haj...becomes a Haji on return to lead...pious life. Then only the pilgrimage is considered meaningful," he said. About 450 pilgrims will leave for Haj on the first flight from Bengaluru.

47.title: Remove Punjab ADGP-Prisons, my brother Majithia not safe: Harsimrat
47.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal said she has urged the Governor of Punjab to remove IPS officer Harpreet Sidhu as ADGP-Prisons saying that there is a threat to former minister Bikram Singh Majithia's life. "He [Sidhu] has been given this post to allow him to settle his personal scores with the former state minister," she added.

48.title: India's playing XI in last 4 or 5 ICC events didn't make sense: Manjrekar
48.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said the kind of playing XI picked by India in the last four or five ICC events did not make sense, adding that they overthought the whole process. "That...hurt India," stated Manjrekar. "The one thing you expect [India head coach] Rahul Dravid to do really well is team selection, picking the right XI," said Manjrekar.

49.title: Nadal is above Muhammad Ali, Pelé, Jordan: Ex-French Open director
49.article_body: Ex-French Open director Guy Forget said he considers Rafael Nadal "above" late boxing legend Muhammad Ali, Brazilian football legend Pelé and NBA legend Michael Jordan. "Nadal has achieved the greatest feat in the...history of sport...[He] has won Roland-Garros 14 times. It is unimaginable," added Forget. "It surprises everyone...and the best part is...it is an ongoing series," he stated.

50.title: Excited to see you walking up the aisle: Vignesh to Nayanthara
50.article_body: Taking to Instagram, filmmaker Vignesh Shivan penned a note for Nayanthara on Thursday ahead of their wedding. Vignesh shared pictures with the actress and wrote, "I owe it all to the good manifestations and prayers! Now, it's all dedicated to the love of my life." He added, "Nayanthara...Excited to see you walking up the aisle in a few hours!"

51.title: J&K's Kulgam school to be named after teacher killed by terrorists
51.article_body: The government high school of Gopalpora in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam will be renamed after Rajni Bala, the teacher who was shot dead by terrorists days ago. Announcing the decision, J&K LG Manoj Sinha said, "I met her [Bala's] family members and all their demands and concerns will be resolved on a priority basis."

52.title: 3 brothers among 5 dead after inhaling toxic gas in well in MP
52.article_body: At least five persons, including three brothers, died on Wednesday after allegedly inhaling suspected toxic gas inside a well in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district, police said. Initially, two persons entered the well to clean it and when they did not come out for long, well owner and three others climbed down to see what was wrong, police added.

53.title: Doctor falls from 7th floor of AIIMS building in Assam, dies
53.article_body: A doctor reportedly died after falling from seventh floor of the under-construction All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Assam's Kamrup on Wednesday. He was rushed to nearby hospital. "Whether it was an accident or suicide, we'll know after a probe," an official said. While AIIMS hasn't been officially opened to public yet, classes at the institute have started.

54.title: Microsoft to not enforce non-compete clauses in US staff agreements
54.article_body: Microsoft has said it will stop enforcing existing non-compete clauses for employees in the US. It said the changes to the enforcement of non-compete clauses would not apply to the company's most senior leadership. It also aims to have salary ranges in all of the company's internal and external job postings across the US by at least January 2023.

55.title: Mumbai Police question 40 people in Salman Khan threat case; 200 CCTV footages seized
55.article_body: Mumbai Police have questioned over 40 people and seized footage from nearly 200 CCTV cameras in connection with a threat letter sent to actor Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan, Times Now reported. Mumbai Police crime branch also questioned jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi in Delhi on Wednesday. Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has denied involvement in the case, reports said.

56.title: Rural roads adjoining cities to be upgraded to four-lane in Haryana
56.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Wednesday said rural roads adjoining cities will be upgraded to four-lane to make traffic movement smoother. Further, welcome gates will be built on these roads and saplings will also be planted to ensure beautification around cities, Khattar added. The CM said this while reviewing projects being undertaken by various departments.

57.title: Babar breaks Kohli's world record, becomes fastest to reach 1,000 ODI runs as captain
57.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has broken former India captain Virat Kohli's world record for being the fastest batter to reach 1,000 runs in ODI cricket as captain. With his 103(107) in the first ODI against West Indies, Babar crossed 1,000 ODI runs in 13 innings as captain. Kohli had set the previous record, taking 17 innings.

58.title: Curious to see Tom Hanks' reaction to 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Aamir Khan
58.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has said that he is "very curious" to see how Tom Hanks reacts to his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', which is an official remake of Hanks' 1994 film 'Forrest Gump'. "'Forrest Gump' is an iconic film...Hanks is a wonderful actor," Aamir stated. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' also features Kareena Kapoor Khan and is directed by Advait Chandan.

59.title: Side chicks will leave me, jokes Arsenal's Partey on Islam conversion
59.article_body: Talking about his conversion to Islam, Arsenal midfielder Thomas Teye Partey jokingly said, "I know my side chicks will leave me but it's no problem." "I grew up with Muslims so...it's the same thing. I have a girl I love," added Partey. The former Atletico Madrid player has announced that he would like to be known as Yakubu.

60.title: Mob attacks 2 polling booths, burn ballot papers in Assam
60.article_body: A mob destroyed ballot boxes at two polling booths and burned ballot papers during a local election in Assam, said police. The violence reportedly erupted after people found out that the rubber stamp used in voting was missing. The police had to fire in the air to control the situation. Re-polling at the booths will be held on June 10.

61.title: Parents beg after hospital staffer allegedly asks for ₹50,000 for son's body in Bihar
61.article_body: Parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from Sadar Hospital after a hospital employee allegedly asked for ₹50,000 to release the body. "We're poor people, how can we pay this amount?" the deceased's father said. "Action will be taken if any employee is found guilty," official said.

62.title: Adivi starts Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan fund for CDS, NDA aspirants
62.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh has announced a fund in the name of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The fund will provide guidance, training and funding for CDS (Combined Defence Services examination) and NDA (National Defence Academy) aspirants across the country. "I'm going to start the fund and will incorporate the help of some more friends as well as actors," Adivi stated.

63.title: 3 PFI activists arrested over Kanpur violence, 54 arrests made so far
63.article_body: UP Police arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) activists in connection with Kanpur violence. A total of 54 arrests have been made, police said. The three activists were previously arrested during anti-CAA protests in 2019, Kanpur Police Commissioner Vijay Singh Meena added. Violence broke out in Kanpur on Friday following former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

64.title: US House votes to raise age to buy semi-automatic weapons to 21
64.article_body: The US House of Representatives has passed a bill seeking to raise the minimum age to buy semi-automatic weapons from 18 years to 21. The bill, passed by 223-204 votes, also calls for banning sale of ammunition magazines that can carry over 15 rounds. This comes days after deadly shooting incidents in Texas, New York and Oklahoma.

65.title: Had no film sets, shot at live locations; was challenging: 'Khuda...' director
65.article_body: Faruk Kabir, director of 'Khuda Haafiz Chapter 2: Agni Pariksha', said that the team shot for the movie at live locations. "We did face a lot of challenges...there were no sets. The film has been shot very honestly without any gimmickry. That's always a challenging task," he said, adding that there was no body double for actor Vidyut Jammwal.

66.title: CISF constable found dead at rented apartment; suicide suspected
66.article_body: A 30-year-old Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at the Pune International Airport was found dead at his rented apartment in Pune. "Primary probe points to it being a case of suicide. We've launched a probe into the sequence of events leading to...death and the reason for him taking the extreme step," senior police inspector Bharat Jadhav said.

67.title: Hrithik loved the original, was 1st to call us: 'Vikram...' co-maker
67.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' co-director Gayatri revealed that Hrithik Roshan loved the original Tamil film, which featured R Madhavan and Vijay Sethupathi. "He was the first actor to call us after its release...we were at a wedding at that time," she added. Gayatri further stated Hrithik is "extremely down to earth". "If we didn't agree, he didn't have a problem," she added.

68.title: What is Kejriwal's compulsion to save Satyendar Jain?: Anurag Thakur
68.article_body: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in an alleged money laundering case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is enacting "drama" over ED’s action. "The charges are very serious and one wonders what is Kejriwal's compulsion in saving Satyendar Jain...Will you only make false allegations to demoralise the investigating agencies?" Thakur asked.

69.title: BSF fires at drone near international border in J&K's Arnia
69.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) troops fired at a drone spotted near the international border in Jammu and Kashmir's Arnia sector on Thursday morning. The drone that was flying at a height of around 300 metres returned back due to the firing, the BSF said. Officials said that the drone activity was from Pakistan.

70.title: I learnt the meaning, value of dal, roti at a young age: Suniel Shetty
70.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he learnt the meaning and value of dal and roti at a young age after being introduced to his father's restaurant business when he was 14 years old. "If we show good direction...we will come up with a genius," added Suniel. "I believe...[the] next Elon Musk and Bill Gates should come from India," stated Suniel.

71.title: Hindutvadis should know Islam rejects terrorism: Owaisi on Al-Qaeda's threat
71.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said "Hindutvadis" should know that Islam rejects terrorism. His statement came after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. "The name of our Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is exalted and does not need terrorists like Al-Qaeda to defend it," Owaisi tweeted.

72.title: 1 dead, 18 injured after building collapses in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar
72.article_body: One person died while 18 others were injured after a two-storey residential building collapsed in Mumbai's Shastri Nagar, ANI reported. One of the injured persons is undergoing treatment, while others have been discharged, it added. The incident occurred at around 12:15 am on Thursday, said Manjunath Singe, DCP Mumbai Police. "All of them are labourers from Bihar," he added.

73.title: Domestic violence doesn't have a gender: Johnny Depp's lawyer on criticism of verdict
73.article_body: On being asked about victims' advocate groups claiming that Johnny Depp's defamation trial victory against his ex-wife Amber Heard is a "blow" to the #MeToo movement, Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez said, "We encourage any victim to come forward." She added, "Domestic violence doesn't have a gender." "The verdict speaks for itself, the facts are what they are," she further stated.

74.title: Delhi Police file FIR against Nupur Sharma, Naveen Jindal, Saba Naqvi for spreading hate
74.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against Naveen Kumar Jindal, the expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit, journalist Saba Naqvi and others for allegedly spreading messages of hate and inciting various groups, according to DCP (IFSO) KPS Malhotra. A second FIR was registered under similar sections against suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and other social media users, police said.

75.title: This was never about money: Depp's lawyer on if he'll forego $10mn payout from Heard
75.article_body: On being asked if Johnny Depp will forego the over $10 million payout from Amber Heard, his lawyer said, "This was never about money for Depp. This was about restoring his reputation, and he's done that." Depp had sued Heard, claiming she defamed him when she published a Washington Post op-ed where she described herself as victim of domestic violence.

76.title: 6 Thai policemen get life sentences for torturing man to death
76.article_body: Six policemen were sentenced to life imprisonment for torturing a 24-year-old drug suspect to death during interrogation in Thailand. The officers were arrested after a video of the interrogation went viral last year. The video showed the suspect's head wrapped with seven plastic bags while being questioned. The officers also tried to extort $60,000 from the man.

77.title: As an actor, I'm getting my due after 20 years: Panchayat actor Faisal
77.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Faisal Malik said he is getting his due after 20 years as an actor, adding his phone hasn't stopped ringing since 'Panchayat' started streaming. "This time, the pressure was huge...I used to sit alone for hours for four-five days," added Faisal. "Earlier I struggled due to not having work, now there is fear with projects available," stated Faisal.

78.title: Pune metro station features in Jawan teaser, official says 'open to offers'
78.article_body: Pune Metro Rail on Wednesday announced on Twitter that its Sant Tukaram Nagar metro station has featured in actor Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan'. "No other filmmakers, after the shooting of Shah Rukh Khan's movie, have approached Maha Metro for film shooting purposes but we are open for such offers in future," a Maha Metro official said.

79.title: About 20,000 meritorious students in Himachal to get laptops
79.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur on Wednesday launched a laptop distribution programme under the Srinivasa Ramanujan Student Digital Scheme to provide free laptops to about 20,000 meritorious students in the state. The government has spent ₹83 crore on the initiative. The CM said this move would motivate other students to excel in academics and win a laptop.

80.title: SP MLC booked for remarks against Lord Shiva, Shivling in UP
80.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and UP MLC Lal Bihari Yadav has been booked for allegedly making offensive remarks against Lord Shiva and Shivling. The action was taken by police based on a complaint from Bajrang Dal workers, who alleged that Yadav's comments hurt religious sentiments. This comes after claims of a Shivling being found in Gyanvapi Mosque premises were made.

81.title: India reports 7,240 new COVID-19 cases, nearly 40% jump for 2nd straight day
81.article_body: India has reported 7,240 COVID-19 cases, 3,591 recoveries, and 8 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,233 COVID-19 cases and 7 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 32,498, while the death toll reached 5,24,723.

82.title: Switch over to e-offices completely by June 30: Delhi govt to all depts
82.article_body: Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government has asked all its departments to switch over to e-offices completely by June 30. All departments have been asked to put the requisite infrastructure in place by June 20, as per the official statement. The departments have also been directed to set up a central record unit, equipped with high-speed scanners, computers and internet connectivity.

83.title: Delhi Metro services delayed on Blue Line, 3rd incident in past 4 days
83.article_body: Train services on Delhi Metro's Blue Line, running between Dwarka Sector-21 and Vaishali and Noida Electronic City, were delayed on Thursday morning, the DMRC said. According to DMRC, an over-head electrification wire has been damaged, which is causing the delay. Notably, this is the third incident in past four days when Blue Line services have been affected.

84.title: Missed opportunity to learn from Aamir Khan during Sarfarosh: Sonali
84.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre recalled working with Aamir Khan in 'Sarfarosh' and stated that she "enjoyed it". "I missed the opportunity to consciously learn from Aamir during 'Sarfarosh'," she added. The film also featured Naseeruddin Shah and was directed by John Matthew Matthan. Sonali, talking about OTT platforms, said, "If OTT platforms wouldn't have come, we wouldn't have got second innings."

85.title: Working with Abhishek should happen; priority is still family, child: Aishwarya
85.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai, while speaking about working with husband and actor Abhishek Bachchan again, said, "It should happen." She also said that her family and her daughter, Aaradhya, continue to remain her priority. "I braved and stepped out to complete Mani sir's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', but that doesn't change my focus for my family and Aaradhya," she added.

86.title: Karnataka reports 376 new COVID-19 cases; 358 in Bengaluru alone
86.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday reported 376 new COVID-19 cases, out of which 358 were reported in Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 222 recoveries the same day, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data showed. With the new infections, the active COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru have risen to 2,526. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 2.01%.

87.title: Applications for Scaler’s Data Science Program soar by 200%: Scaler
87.article_body: Scaler shares that since they have opened doors to non-coders for its Data Science program, demand has doubled with more than 30,000 applications received in May alone. The program comes with two specializations depending on the learner's background. Non-coders can upskill with Analytics while experienced professionals can deep dive into coding with Machine Learning specialization, stated Scaler.

88.title: We need US General to call out Chinese activities near Ladakh: Owaisi
88.article_body: After a US General called Chinese build-up near Ladakh alarming, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said it should shame the government that a foreigner has to say it. "We need US General to tell us that the situation in Ladakh from the Chinese preparations and activities is 'alarming' and 'eye-opening' because our vocal PM has forgotten how to pronounce China," he tweeted.

89.title: Hyd gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik sent to 3-day police custody
89.article_body: A Nampally court in Telangana sent Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gang-rape case accused Saduddin Malik to three-day police custody till June 11. Notably, Malik is the only major among the six accused who have been arrested. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped when she was returning home after a party in the Jubilee Hills area on May 28.

90.title: Which are the world's 20 best universities as per latest rankings?
90.article_body: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) was ranked the world's best university for the 11th year in a row in the latest rankings by global higher education analysts Quacquarelli Symonds (QS). Apart from MIT, eight other US universities made it to the top 20. UK's University of Cambridge was ranked second. Switzerland's ETH Zurich was ranked ninth.

91.title: Iran raises concern over Prophet remark with India, NSA Ajit Doval assures action
91.article_body: Iran's Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian, who's on a visit to India, raised the controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad by two former BJP leaders with NSA Ajit Doval. Doval noted that the people involved "will be dealt with at the level of the government and related agencies in a way that is a lesson to others", according to Iran's Foreign Ministry.

92.title: No country except India is providing money for fuel: Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
92.article_body: Urging IMF to "expedite" its assistance programme to Sri Lanka, the country's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that no country except India is providing money for fuel amid the economic crisis. Stating that India cannot go on providing aid to Sri Lanka, Wickremesinghe further said, "Our Indian credit line is now nearing its end. We are talking about extending it."

93.title: Which are the top Indian institutes in latest world university rankings?
93.article_body: Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru emerged as the topmost Indian institute, ranking at the 155th spot, in the QS World University Rankings 2023.It is followed by IIT Bombay (172), IIT Delhi (174), IIT Madras (250), IIT Kanpur (264), IIT Kharagpur (270), IIT Roorkee (369), IIT Guwahati (384) and IIT Indore (396). Delhi University comes next on the list.

94.title: Fire breaks out at building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market, 80 rescued
94.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar market on Wednesday, officials said. At least 80 people were rescued safely by fire personnel from three floors. Notably, the building houses a private bank on the ground and first floors, and a private company on the second and third floors.

95.title: Fire breaks out in evidence room of police station in Delhi, probe on
95.article_body: A fire broke out in 'malkhana' or evidence room of Delhi's Mandawali police station on Wednesday night. Reports said 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was brought under control late at night. No casualties were reported in the incident. Police said that some property was damaged in the fire and a probe has been initiated.

96.title: Famous Afghan model arrested by Taliban for disrespecting Islam; video surfaces
96.article_body: The Taliban have arrested a famous Afghan fashion model and three of his colleagues, accusing them of disrespecting Islam and the Quran. Ajmal Haqiqi appeared handcuffed in videos posted on Twitter by the Taliban intelligence agency on Tuesday. In a viral video, Haqiqi was seen laughing as his colleague Ghulam Sakhi recited verses of Quran in a comical voice.

97.title: Couldn't go to Switzerland for 'Dilwale..', SRK, Aditya still remind me: Farah
97.article_body: Choreographer Farah Khan said after late choreographer Saroj Khan refused to work on songs of 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', filmmaker Aditya Chopra and actor Shah Rukh Khan asked her to fly to Switzerland immediately. She said she could not go due to another ongoing project. Farah added that Chopra and Khan remind her of her refusal even today.

98.title: Haven't forgotten: Maha CM on renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar
98.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that he has not forgotten his late father Balasaheb Thackeray's promise of renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and said, "We will change it." "Hindutva is in our every breath," Uddhav Thackeray added. Criticising BJP in a rally in Aurangabad, he said, "If you have the courage then go and recite Hanuman Chalisa in Kashmir."

99.title: They work to spread violence: RSS leader on Al-Qaeda's threat
99.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar said organisations like terror outfit Al-Qaeda "work to spread violence", after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. He said, "Such an attitude is anti-Khuda, anti-Islam, anti-Muhammad and anti-humanity." The threat came after ex-BJP leaders' remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

100.title: 3 killed, 7 injured as shop collapses in Rajasthan's Udaipur
100.article_body: Police said three labourers were killed and seven others were injured after a shop collapsed when digging work was underway near an under-construction shop in Rajasthan's Udaipur district. Police added that the adjoining shop collapsed, leaving three labourers identified as Nilesh Menaria, Bhavesh Tamboli and Jaspal Singh dead. The injured are being treated, the police added.

101.title: Arhaan was in shock after my accident, he didn't believe anyone: Malaika
101.article_body: Malaika Arora recalled how her son Arhaan was in a "shock" after he came to know about her car accident. "He had no clue of the extent of damage that I'd suffered. He only wanted to be sure that I was fine," she added. "Although he was told everything about my surgery and recovery, he didn't believe anyone," she said.

102.title: Working with Farhan was amazing, he's fascinating: Ms Marvel actress Iman
102.article_body: Speaking about working with Farhan Akhtar in Ms Marvel, actress Iman Vellani said,  "My experience working with Farhan was amazing...On set, we'd have quiet moments and he'd just be telling me stories about going sky-diving, what it's like filming...movies." "I find him...a fascinating person...It's crazy that I grew up watching him and now I'm working with him," she added.

103.title: PM needs to step in if he wants to stop this poison: Naseeruddin on Prophet remark
103.article_body: Naseeruddin Shah expressed his resentment over derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "I wish...the hatemongers whom...PM seems to follow on Twitter, he does something to silence them," the actor told NDTV. "I think this is the time when he needs to step in if he really wants to stop this poison from spreading," he added.

104.title: Taapsee Pannu lists Mithali Raj's achievements, says 'You changed the game'
104.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who is portraying Mithali Raj in upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu', took to social media to pen a note following the cricketer's retirement from international cricket. "Some personalities and their achievements are gender agnostic...You changed the game, now it's our turn to change the perspective!" she wrote, listing Mithali's achievements.

105.title: Govt issues high-severity warnings for Google Chrome & Mozilla Firefox users
105.article_body: The government's Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) recently flagged vulnerabilities in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox products. Chrome versions prior to 96.0.4664.209 are affected with vulnerabilities which could be exploited by attackers, CERT-In said. Vulnerabilities in Firefox could allow attackers to disclose sensitive information, bypass security restrictions etc, it said.

106.title: I-T Dept mistakenly reduces TDS on virtual digital assets to 0.1%, corrects it to 1%
106.article_body: Income Tax Department portal on Wednesday updated its document on tax deducted at source (TDS), reiterating that TDS on payments made on the transfer of virtual digital assets remains at 1%, as stated in Budget. The website earlier mentioned that it has been dropped to 0.1%. However, after the change was noticed, the website updated the document rectifying the error.

107.title: Entire country stands with Kashmiri Pandits: Arvind Kejriwal
107.article_body: Greeting Kashmiri Pandits on 'Jyeshtha Ashtami', Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "I want to assure the Kashmiri Pandit community that the entire country is standing shoulder to shoulder with you in your...happiness and sorrow." His tweet comes amid the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. "May the blessings of Maa Kheer Bhavani always be with you all," Kejriwal tweeted.

108.title: Latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers released
108.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters and bowlers. England's Joe Root jumped to the second spot in batters' rankings, while New Zealand captain Kane Williamson dropped to the fifth spot. Meanwhile, New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson jumped to the third position in the bowlers' rankings. England pacer James Anderson jumped two spots to be ranked seventh.

109.title: Future belongs to the BJP: JP Nadda in Kolkata
109.article_body: Addressing the state executive committee meeting in Kolkata, BJP National President JP Nadda said the "future belongs to the BJP" and that his party will defeat TMC in the next elections. Criticising West Bengal's ruling party, he said, "The TMC has no principles or policies, it has only syndicates." He added, "In politics, there is nothing static, things change."

110.title: 2 independent MLAs join BJP in Himachal Pradesh
110.article_body: Two independent MLAs in Himachal Pradesh, Hoshiyar Singh and Prakash Rana, joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of Chief Minister Jairam Thakur and state BJP President Suresh Kashyap. The independent legislators' joining would make the party and the government stronger, CM Thakur said. Both Singh and Rana had been supporting BJP in the Assembly for long, Suresh Kashyap said.

111.title: Rare 'Indian lipstick plant' spotted in Arunachal after over 100 years
111.article_body: A rare plant, sometimes called the 'Indian lipstick plant', has been rediscovered in the Anjaw district of Arunachal Pradesh after over 100 years, the Botanical Survey of India (BSI) researchers said. Aeschynanthus monetaria Dunn plant was last spotted in 1912 when English botanist Isaac Henry Burkill collected its samples. BSI scientist Krishna Chowlu found it again in December 2021.

112.title: Video shows Bengal CM dancing with tribals at mass wedding ceremony
112.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee danced with a group of tribal women during a mass wedding ceremony in North Bengal's Alipurduar. A video shows the Chief Minister blessing the newly-married couples. "Being part of the magnificent ceremony, she wholeheartedly celebrated and expressed her desire to see our Adivasi brothers and sisters achieve great heights of success," TMC tweeted.

113.title: Break ties with India: Imran Khan to Pak govt on Prophet remark row
113.article_body: Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday asked the country's government to sever ties with India and boycott Indian products in response to ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Khan alleged that India had been allowed to get away with its "Islamophobic policies" so far. Countries including Qatar and Kuwait had summoned Indian envoys over the remarks.

114.title: Proud of my guy: Shibani on Farhan's 1st look from his H'wood debut Ms Marvel
114.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar said that she is extremely proud of her husband, actor Farhan Akhtar, who made his Hollywood debut with 'Ms Marvel'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Shibani expressed her excitement about Farhan's role in the show and wrote, "Can't wait for this. So proud of my guy."

115.title: Delhi logs 564 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs; 114 more than Tuesday
115.article_body: Delhi reported 564 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, an increase of 114 cases as compared to Tuesday's tally. The national capital reported one death and the positivity rate surged to 2.84% as compared to the previous day's tally of 1.92%. The overall case count in Delhi stands at 19,09,991, while there are 1,691 active cases.

116.title: UN's plan to restart Ukraine grain exports is reasonable: Türkiye
116.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Wednesday said that UN's plan to restart grain exports from Ukraine along a sea corridor was "reasonable". "We're ready to guarantee the safety of vessels leaving Ukrainian ports and heading for (Turkish waters)," Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said. Ukrainian grain supplies are stuck for export as Russia has blockaded Ukraine's Black Sea ports.

117.title: What records does Mithali Raj hold in international cricket?
117.article_body: Mithali Raj, who retired from international cricket, is the highest run-scorer in women's international cricket (10,868 runs). She's the highest run-scorer in women's ODIs with 7,805 runs. She has scored the most fifty-plus scores (71) in women's ODIs. She also holds the record for being the youngest batter (16 years and 205 days) to slam a century in women's ODIs.

118.title: FIR filed after 5-yr-old Delhi girl left under sun for not doing homework
118.article_body: After a video showed a five-year-old girl being tied up and left on the roof of a house for not doing homework, the police have registered an FIR under the Juvenile Justice Act. The case has been registered at the Khajuri Khas Police Station. Further investigation is underway in connection with the case.

119.title: CISF writes to MHA to review Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana's security
119.article_body: The CISF has written to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) to review the security of Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana. Navneet was accorded 'Y' category security cover in April. Navneet and her husband were granted bail in May after being arrested in a sedition case over threats to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence in Mumbai.

120.title: Kamal Haasan gifts his Rolex watch worth ₹47 lakh to Suriya, actor shares pics
120.article_body: Following the success of 'Vikram', actor Kamal Haasan on Wednesday gifted actor Suriya, who played the role of Rolex in the film, his own Rolex watch worth ₹47 lakh. Sharing pictures on social media, Suriya wrote, ''A moment like this makes life beautiful! Thank you Anna for your #Rolex!" 'Vikram' is Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide.

121.title: Great efforts: China on India helping Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
121.article_body: The Indian government has made "great efforts" to help Sri Lanka during its worst economic crisis, China said on Wednesday. China recognises India's efforts, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said. "We also are willing to work with India and other members of the international community to help Sri Lanka and other countries with difficulties," he added.

122.title: Don't sell country for few pieces of gold: BJP to Kerala govt
122.article_body: BJP criticised the CPI(M)-led LDF government in Kerala on Wednesday over a case of alleged gold smuggling and asked it to not sell the country for a few pieces of gold. "The Kerala Chief Minister should look into his conscience after these charges and step down from his post," BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said.

123.title: Contract of coach who allegedly asked Indian woman cyclist to sleep with him terminated
123.article_body: Sports Authority of India (SAI) terminated the contract of cycling coach RK Sharma following allegations of inappropriate behaviour against him by a top Indian woman cyclist. It noted that "prima facie, the case is established and the allegations...are found to be true". The cyclist alleged Sharma forced himself into her room in Slovenia and asked her to sleep with him.

124.title: Issuing threats not Indian culture: Uma Bharti on Prophet remark row
124.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti condemned threats being issued to suspended party spokesperson Nupur Sharma over latter's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Our party gave punishment to [her] and MEA handled [the] situation on [the] reaction of Muslim nations well but threats to Nupur Sharma is not Indian culture," Bharti said. Sharma was suspended from the party on June 5.

125.title: BJP govt's 'conspiracy' behind Nupur Sharma's remarks: Cong leader
125.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao alleged that a "conspiracy" by BJP-led Centre is behind the controversial remarks of former party spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "With their controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, a lot of damage was caused to our country at the international level," Rao said. "BJP leaders like Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal should be arrested immediately," he added.

126.title: No need for anti-conversion law in Bihar: CM Nitish Kumar
126.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that there is "no need" for an anti-conversion law in the state. "The government has always been alert here. And all people, be they from any religious group, live in peace," Nitish Kumar said. Union minister Giriraj Singh had earlier said that there is a need for an anti-conversion law in the state.

127.title: That's wrong, I was kicked out of college: Mrunal on having 2 college degrees
127.article_body: Mrunal Thakur, who made her acting debut with a television show in 2012, while she was in college, said the reports that she has two degrees are false. "That's wrong. Whoever has written that...[on] Wikipedia, I'm...thankful," she added. "I don't have any degree. I was kicked out of college. I was detained from [college]...because I had attendance problems," Mrunal said.

128.title: Fintech market likely to reach $150 bn valuation by 2025: MoS Finance
128.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Wednesday said the growth in Indian fintech startups has been exponential and the market is expected to reach a valuation of $150 billion by 2025. India's fintech adoption rate is at 87% as against the global average of 64%, Chaudhary noted. Fintech is one of India's immensely growing sectors, he added.

129.title: Northeast marching ahead to be at par with rest of India: Minister
129.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Wednesday said that the Northeast is marching ahead to be at par with the rest of India. "Congress never gave importance to Northeast in the last 60 years due to which the region remained neglected despite its huge potential," he said. Had to face several challenges in the development of the region, he added.

130.title: UN collaborates with Uber to deliver aid in Ukraine amid war
130.article_body: The UN's World Food Programme (WFP) has teamed up with Uber to supply aid to people in war-torn Ukraine. Uber's customised 'Uber Direct' software app will help coordinate, dispatch and track a fleet of smaller vehicles in areas where large vehicles may not be able to reach. WFP aims to provide aid to three million people per month by June.

131.title: Only India providing money for fuel: Lankan PM amid forex crisis
131.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday urged the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to "expedite" its assistance programme to Sri Lanka and said India is the only country providing money for fuel to the crisis-hit nation. Sri Lanka has already begun restructuring its foreign debts, a prerequisite for an IMF programme. The country suspended external debt payments on April 12.

132.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature today released
132.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that recorded maximum temperature of 44°C and above on Wednesday. Rajasthan's Ganganagar and Vidarbha's Bramhapuri recorded highest maximum temperature at 46.2°C, followed by 45.7°C in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehgarh. Chhattisgarh's Durg and Vidarbha's Gondia recorded maximum temperature of 45.6°C, while several places also recorded maximum temperature of 45.2°C.

133.title: Baseless: KT Jaleel on allegations made in gold smuggling case
133.article_body: Ex-Kerala Minister KT Jaleel on Wednesday filed a police complaint against allegations levelled by Kerala gold smuggling case prime accused Swapna Suresh, calling the allegations "baseless". Jaleel said the allegations are part of a controversy hatched by Suresh, ex-Congress MLA PC George and BJP. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan also dismissed Suresh's allegations against him and his family.

134.title: Still don't know why my son was killed: Sidhu Moosewala's father
134.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's father on Wednesday said he still does not understand why his son was killed and stated that the family will not rest till he gets justice. "We have given time to the government," he said, referring to the action to be taken against the perpetrators. "Until we get justice, we will not rest," he added.

135.title: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi masterminded Sidhu Moosewala's killing: Delhi Police
135.article_body: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi is the mastermind behind the killing of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, Delhi Police said on Wednesday. Bishnoi had earlier denied a role in Moosewala's killing while admitting he was killed for revenge. At least five people were involved in the killing, Delhi Police Special CP HGS Dhaliwal said.

136.title: People will see me in action comedy avatar: Kartik Aaryan on Shehzada
136.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Shehzada', actor Kartik Aaryan said that it is one of those films that has a very wide appeal among the audiences. "I am really excited and looking forward to the film," he added. "People will get to see me in this complete avatar of action and comedy for the first time," Kartik said.

137.title: Musk shares meme targeting YouTube over 'scam ads', Twitter users say 'Buy YouTube'
137.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "YouTube seems to be nonstop scam ads." He also shared a meme on YouTube's policy against people swearing as opposed to when there are "obvious scam ads all over their site". "Please buy YouTube," a Twitter user reacted. "Once you learn...about their free speech policies, you...may try to buy them too," another comment read.

138.title: Azadi March will continue even if Pak govt puts us in jail: Khan
138.article_body: Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday challenged the government to stop him from leading Azadi March movement. He added that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf's (PTI) movement against the government will continue even if the administration puts PTI workers in jail or resorts to other measures. Khan was granted pre-arrest bail till June 25 after being accused of inciting violence at the rally.

139.title: Sought red corner notice against Brar 10 days before Moosewala's death: Punjab Police
139.article_body: The Punjab Police on Wednesday said it had sought a red corner notice against Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar on May 19, 10 days before Sidhu Moosewala's murder. Brar has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder on behalf of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. The red corner notice was sought in two separate cases registered against Brar in Faridkot.

140.title: 5-yr-old girl tied up, left on hot roof for not doing homework in Delhi; video surfaces
140.article_body: A video of a five-year-old girl tied up and left on the roof of a house as punishment in Delhi has been widely shared online, leading to an inquiry by the police. The girl was left in the scorching heat for not doing her homework, officials said. The video showed the child screaming and writhing on the roof.

141.title: Didn't want to do Pyaar Ka Punchnama, Rajkummar said, 'Are you mad?': Nushrratt
141.article_body: Nushrratt Bharuccha said after the success of her film 'Love Sex Aur Dhokha' (LSD), she wanted to do films in that genre and had refused to do 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. "But then I had good co-stars in LSD, Raj (Rajkummar Rao) and Amit (Sial) who said, 'Are you mad? You're being offered a film. It's a big deal'," she added.

142.title: Mumbai sees 1,765 new COVID cases, highest since Jan 25; positivity rate at 9.19%
142.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,765 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 25. The city reported a 42% increase in fresh cases in a single day as it reported 1,242 cases on Tuesday. The COVID-19 positivity rate in the city has risen to 9.19%, while zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours.

143.title: K'taka man kills 17-yr-old daughter over relationship with Dalit boy
143.article_body: A man allegedly strangled his 17-year-old daughter to death for having a relationship with a Dalit boy and surrendered before the police in the Mysuru district of Karnataka on Tuesday. Despite being asked not to, the deceased contacted the boy on Monday, which led to an altercation with her father, following which he strangled her to death, police said.

144.title: Shilpa gifts herself vanity van with yoga deck on her 47th b'day; pics surface
144.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty reportedly gifted herself a new vanity van with a kitchenette, hair wash station, and a yoga deck on her 47th birthday. According to reports, she wanted to ensure that even when she's shooting, she can practice yoga within the comforts of her own vanity van. Several pictures of the vanity van have also surfaced online.

145.title: Chennithala demands Kerala CM's ouster amid gold smuggling scam
145.article_body: Kerala Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala on Wednesday reacted to the allegations levelled against CM Pinarayi Vijayan by Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, stating the claims made are "unprecedented and shocking". Chennithala also demanded Vijayan's resignation. Suresh has claimed that CM Vijayan, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.

146.title: Fringe is BJP's core: Rahul Gandhi amid row over remarks on Prophet
146.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said "fringe" is the BJP's core and highlighted some derogatory statements made by BJP leaders in the past. The post included comments by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who allegedly called Bangladeshi migrants "termites" and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who said that women "are not capable of being left free or independent".

147.title: Shutdown in J&K over social media posts backing BJP's Nupur Sharma
147.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar town observed a shutdown demanding the arrest of three Bharatiya Janata Party and IkkJutt Jammu leaders for their alleged social media posts extending support to BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The three leaders, according to the protesters, include Ashish Sharma, the BJP's Youth Wing general secretary in J&K and IkkJutt leaders Sparsh Parihar and Anshuman Rathore.

148.title: Pause, take a look: Editors' body to news channels over Kanpur violence
148.article_body: Editors Guild of India on Wednesday said it's disturbed by "irresponsible" conduct of some national news channels after violence broke out in Kanpur. "The EGI demands that these channels pause and take a critical look at what they have done by giving legitimacy to divisive and toxic voices," it said. EGI called for stricter vigilance by broadcasters and journalist bodies.

149.title: Don't fall prey to fraudulent texts on bill payments: BESCOM
149.article_body: Amid Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) consumers getting fraudulent texts of discontinuation of electricity due to non-payment of bills, the company has told its consumers that these texts are fake. BESCOM clarified that it does not insist on payment through text messages. "We have taken cognisance of such fraudulent acts by reporting...to cybercrime police," officials said.

150.title: Orangutan attacks man by pulling his T-shirt & grabbing his leg in Indonesia zoo
150.article_body: A viral video has captured an orangutan attacking a man through its cage. The video, filmed at an Indonesian zoo, shows the ape dragging him closer by first grabbing his T-shirt and then holding one of his legs and refusing to let go. The visitor reportedly broke rules by climbing over the fence separating the orangutan enclosure from zoo visitors.

151.title: Unscientific: India on getting lowest rank on global environment performance index
151.article_body: India has rejected the analysis of the 2022 Environmental Performance Index, which ranked it lowest among 180 countries. "Some of these indicators used for assessing performance are extrapolated and based on...unscientific methods," said the Environment Ministry. Many indicators of the index, devised by Yale and Columbia University researchers, are based on "unfounded assumptions", it said.

152.title: KL Rahul, Kuldeep Yadav ruled out of T20I series against SA; Rishabh Pant named captain
152.article_body: KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been ruled out of India's T20I series against South Africa owing to injury. The BCCI have named wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant as captain of the side in place of Rahul. Meanwhile, all-rounder Hardik Pandya has been appointed vice-captain for the series. The five-match series will begin on Thursday.

153.title: Latvian national held with cocaine worth ₹69 cr at Mumbai airport
153.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested a 24-year-old Latvian national for alleged possession of 6.9 kg of cocaine worth ₹69 crore at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, an official said on Wednesday. A DRI official said that the accused was traveling from Brazil and had concealed the contraband material in plastic pouches in a trolley bag.

154.title: 5 injured in blast triggered to dig up a well on riverbed in Pune
154.article_body: At least five people were injured in a blast triggered to dig up a well on the Mula Mutha riverbed in Pune's Kharadi area. Tin roofs of six houses were damaged due to the explosion. None of the injured persons required hospitalisation, police said, adding that one of the persons who triggered the blast had been arrested.

155.title: Cannot cancel liquor vend licence over public sentiment: Delhi HC
155.article_body: Delhi High Court has ruled that a licence issued under the Delhi Excise Act, 2009 cannot be cancelled merely because "public sentiment" is against a liquor vend's location. It said licences can only be cancelled if they fall foul of statutory provisions or violate rules. Public opinion isn't relevant under the Act for locating a liquor vend, the HC added.

156.title: Harmanpreet Kaur appointed India Women ODI captain after Mithali Raj's retirement
156.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement from international cricket, Harmanpreet Kaur was appointed the captain of the India Women ODI team. The BCCI announced India Women squad for the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka, naming Harmanpreet as captain and Smriti Mandhana as vice-captain. Mithali retired from international cricket after a 23-year-long career.

157.title: Was like 'It's too much': Neena on being offered lot of money for a project
157.article_body: When asked if she's paid well for her work now after facing financial issues for many years, Neena Gupta said, "I've been offered...good money...I...asked my manager how much money I'm getting and I was told this much." "I was like 'nahi yaar, ye...bahut jyada hain, itne kyu maange (no, it's too much, why did you ask for it)'," she added.

158.title: Debt got costlier amid inflation: Congress on RBI's repo rate hike
158.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala reacted to RBI's repo rate hike stating that the move will negatively impact people. "Today, the repo rate has increased...by 0.50%...People tied with debts will now be forced to deal with increased EMIs. Debt became costlier along with inflation, unemployment and empty pockets," Surjewala said. RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%.

159.title: Delhi court upholds order discharging Delhi CM, Dy CM in assault case
159.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday upheld a trial court's order giving clean chit to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia in a case of alleged assault on former chief secretary Anshu Prakash. Prakash had alleged that he was called for a meeting at Kejriwal's residence in 2018 and was assaulted by AAP MLAs.

160.title: He was under threat; used to travel with bodyguards: Jose Covaco on Raghu
160.article_body: Jose Covaco, who worked closely with Raghu Ram on MTV's Roadies, recalled how Raghu took the show to another level. In an appearance on The Ranveer Show podcast, Jose said the show was so popular that judges had to be barricaded and would always travel with bodyguards. He added because Raghu had a controversial image, he was constantly under threat.

161.title: Italy arrests 14 Pakistanis linked to 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack
161.article_body: Italy's anti-terrorism police and Europol on Tuesday arrested 14 Pakistanis in Genoa during an anti-terror raid, reports stated. The arrested persons have been accused of having links with Zaheer Hassan Mahmoud, the alleged conspirator of the 2020 Charlie Hebdo attack in Paris. Mahmoud had allegedly attacked two people after Charlie Hebdo republished controversial cartoons of Prophet Muhammad.

162.title: Alarming, eye-opening: US General on Chinese activity near Ladakh
162.article_body: American General Charles A Flynn on Wednesday commented on the buildup of Chinese infrastructure near Ladakh. Flynn, who's on a four-day India visit, said, "The [Chinese] activity level is eye-opening. Some of the infrastructure being created in the PLA's Western Theatre Command is alarming." He said the Chinese must be questioned about their intentions with regard to the infrastructre.

163.title: Iran removes 2 UN watchdog surveillance cameras from nuclear facility
163.article_body: Iran has removed two surveillance cameras of the UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) from one of its nuclear facilities, state media reported. "Iran cannot be cooperative while...IAEA displays unreasonable behaviour. We hope the agency will come to its senses and respond with cooperation with Iran," Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation spokesman Behrouz Kamalvandi said.

164.title: Hyd teen loses ₹36 lakh received after father's death in gambling
164.article_body: A teenage boy in Hyderabad gambled away ₹36 lakh received as ex-gratia after his father's death. His father was a police officer who had died on duty, after which the ex-gratia amount was deposited into the deceased's wife's account. The police informed the woman that her son was using a mobile gaming platform to place bets with the money.

165.title: 'Hidden world' of marine life discovered under Antarctic ice, pics released
165.article_body: A 'hidden world' of aquatic life has been discovered 500 metres below the ice in Antarctica with shrimp-like creatures in a vast cathedral-like cavern. Scientists from New Zealand found the ecosystem under the Ross ice shelf as they were investigating impact of global warming in a suspected estuary. They captured the organisms after lowering a camera through a drill hole.

166.title: Grant me bail as CBI chargesheet is incomplete: Anil Deshmukh to court
166.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh on Wednesday approached the Mumbai special court for default bail, claiming that the CBI chargesheet filed against him was incomplete. Deshmukh sought bail under Criminal Procedure Code's Section 167(2) which allows the accused to file for bail if chargesheet is not filed within 60-90 days. CBI filed chargesheet without completing investigation, Deshmukh said.

167.title: Rajasthan minister Meghwal gets threat call demanding ₹70 lakh, FIR filed
167.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Wednesday said he has received a threat call from a man, who identified himself as a member of the SOPU gang and demanded ₹70 lakh from him. An FIR has been registered in this case, police said. Meghwal is staying at a resort in Udaipur with other Congress MLAs ahead of Rajya Sabha polls.

168.title: Navi Mumbai to add 75 new AC buses to its fleet soon
168.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT), the civic transport wing, will add 75 more air-conditioned buses to its fleet soon. According to an NMMT official, a tender for 25 buses has been floated and 10 buses will be double-decker buses. The remaining tenders will be finalised by the end of the month, officials said.

169.title: 2 Thane history-sheeters arrested, ₹4.35 lakh stolen items seized
169.article_body: The Kopar Khairane Police arrested two history-sheeters for chain snatching and recovered stolen items worth ₹4.35 lakh from them. With their arrest, police claimed to have solved at least five cases of chain snatching in its jurisdiction. The accused were earlier arrested for their involvement in similar cases and after getting bail, they committed another crime, the police said.

170.title: Man held with foreign currency worth ₹2.7 cr at Delhi metro station
170.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force on Tuesday apprehended a man at the Punjabi Bagh West Metro Station with foreign currencies worth around ₹2.7 crore, an official said. The accused was intercepted around 1:20 pm and informed CISF officials that he was carrying the money for exchange purposes. He was handed over to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning.

171.title: Will respond to destabilising moves in north Syria: Turkey to Russia
171.article_body: During a phone call on Tuesday, Turkish Defence Minister Hulusi Akar told Russian counterpart Sergei Shoigu that Turkey will respond to moves aimed at disrupting stability in northern Syria. Last month, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Turkey would soon be launching new military offensives into northern Syria against Kurdish YPG militia, which it considers a terrorist organisation.

172.title: Pre-monsoon work completed in old city limits: Pune civic body
172.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has claimed to have completed all the pre-monsoon work within old city limits and cleaned all manholes, stormwater lines, culverts and other spots prone to waterlogging. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar also held a review meeting on Tuesday to assess the work done to curb flooding. Notably, 76 waterlogging-prone spots identified by PMC have been cleared.

173.title: Over 9,000 trees cut in Bengaluru due to metro project: RTI data
173.article_body: The Namma Metro project in Karnataka's Bengaluru has led to the loss of over 9,000 trees in the city, according to details available under RTI Act. The said number of chopped trees is only related to Purple and Green Lines. The RTI also revealed that BMRCL axed 680 more trees between 2008 and 2019 for other projects in Bengaluru.

174.title: Major fire breaks out at plastic godown in Thane, doused within 3 hours
174.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic godown in Thane's Bhiwandi on Wednesday.
