350.article_body: Japan will reopen to tourists from June 10 after a two-year COVID-19 closure but will require them to wear masks and avail private medical insurance, government said on Tuesday. Tourists will be chaperoned throughout their stay and only visitors on package tours will be allowed entry during first phase of reopening. International students were allowed entry to Japan in March.

351.title: MLA's minor son accused in case of 17-year-old's gangrape in car in Hyderabad
351.article_body: An AIMIM MLA's son has been named as an accused in the gangrape case of a minor girl in a car in Hyderabad, police said on Tuesday. The MLA's son is a minor and has been named as the sixth accused in the case, police said. All accused, including one adult and five minors, are in police custody, reports said.

352.title: China to offer rewards for info about breach of national security
352.article_body: China has announced that it'll offer cash rewards from 10,000 yuan (nearly $1,500) to over 1,00,000 yuan (about $15,000) for tip-offs on breach of national security under measures introduced this week, state media reported. The government will also provide citizens with special certificates. The amount of the reward will be decided on the basis of the value of the tip-off.

353.title: ABD's only ODI golden duck came after 220 matches, 12 years
353.article_body: Ex-South African cricketer AB de Villiers recorded his first and only ODI golden duck in his 221st match (212 innings) on June 7, 2017, over 12 years after his ODI debut. The then South African captain was caught by Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez off Imad Wasim's bowling in a Champions Trophy match. De Villiers registered seven ODI ducks in his career.

354.title: Karthik has been picked in India's squad to bat at backend of game: Dravid
354.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's role in upcoming T20I series against South Africa, India head coach Rahul Dravid said the wicketkeeper-batter was picked in India's 18-member squad to perform the role of a finisher like he did for RCB in IPL 2022. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches for RCB in this year's IPL at a strike rate of 183.33.

355.title: Ryanair asks UK-bound S African passengers to take language test
355.article_body: Ryanair has mandated UK-bound South African passengers to take a language test in Afrikaans to prove their nationality before travelling. Airline authorities have claimed that the test is an attempt to weed out passengers carrying fraudulent South African passports. Notably, Afrikaans is spoken by 12% of the South African population and was linked to the apartheid era in the country.

356.title: Chhattisgarh is ATM for Congress: BJP on mining at Hasdeo Aranya
356.article_body: Demanding Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo's resignation over the Hasdeo Aranya protests, BJP leader Brijmohan Agrawal criticised Congress and said, "Chhattisgarh is an ATM for the Congress." Agrawal further said that the ruling party 'did not care' about the people of the state. Tribals in Hasdeo Aranya have been protesting against mining inside the area for around 100 days.

357.title: Woman gives birth to identical twins 3 days apart in US, pic surfaces
357.article_body: In a rare occurrence, a woman named Carmen Martinez in Texas gave birth to identical twin daughters three days apart. "They had their own separate placenta and...sac," she said. Martinez said she was advised to delay the birth of her second baby to increase her chance of survival after the first baby was admitted to the NICU after her birth.

358.title: Rajasthan BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal gets notice in 5-yr-old case
358.article_body: The Rajasthan Police has sent a notice to BJP MLA Chandrakanta Meghwal in a five-year-old assault case. Meghwal, who represents the Keshoraipatan assembly constituency, has been asked to appear before the police to cooperate in the investigation. Meghwal is among the BJP MLAs who are camping at a resort in Jaipur ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls.

359.title: 5-yr-old UP girl suspected to have contracted monkeypox tests -ve
359.article_body: A five-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, who was suspected to have been infected with monkeypox, has tested negative for the virus. The girl's samples had been sent to Pune's ICMR-NIV for testing. So far, no monkeypox case has been reported in the country. CMO Ghaziabad earlier said the girl had complaints of itching and rashes on her body.

360.title: Vietnam arrests Health Minister, Hanoi Mayor over corruption scandal
360.article_body: Vietnam's Health Minister Nguyen Thanh Long and Hanoi Mayor Chu Ngoc Anh were sacked from their roles and arrested following accusations that they were involved in a COVID-19 test-kit corruption scandal. The scandal involved bribery in exchange for supplying hospitals with overpriced kits. Reportedly, their arrests come amid an intensifying anti-corruption drive that was launched in 2016.

361.title: Stop blaming us for your failure: RSS leader on Kerala CM's remark
361.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar criticised Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan for his comments on former BJP leader Nupur Sharma's statement on Prophet Muhammad, saying he should be 'sued for hate speech'. "Pointing fingers at RSS is equivalent to spitting on the sun...the spit falls on your face," Kumar said. Political leaders should 'stop blaming RSS for their own failures', he added.

362.title: SAD alleges threat to ex-minister Bikram Majithia's life in jail
362.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Tuesday alleged threat to the life of former minister Bikram Singh Majithia, who is lodged in the Patiala Central Jail in a drugs case. SAD leaders Maheshinder Singh Grewal and Dr Daljit Singh Cheema also alleged that there was a likelihood of Majithia being implicated in another "false" case. Majithia had surrendered on February 24.

363.title: 12 more arrested in Kanpur violence, total 50 arrests made: Police
363.article_body: Police have arrested 12 more people in connection with Kanpur violence, taking the total number of arrests made to 50, an official said. DCP (East) Pramod Kumar said that a 16-year-old boy surrendered after his picture appeared on posters put up by the police. Violence erupted in parts of Kanpur on Friday in protest against "insulting comments" on Prophet Muhammad.

364.title: Ukraine will fight for all its territory, stalemate no option: Prez
364.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday that the country will fight to recover all its territory occupied by Russian forces, adding that stalemate is "not an option". "We have already lost too many people to simply cede our territory...We have to achieve...full deoccupation," he added. Russian forces have been fighting in eastern Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to seize power.

365.title: I wasn't the favourite in French Open 2022 quarters vs Djokovic: Nadal
365.article_body: Rafael Nadal said world number one Novak Djokovic was the favourite to win their quarter-final match at the recently concluded French Open. "Normally it would have gone differently, but it's true that this place has something special," he added. Nadal, who won French Open for the record-extending 14th time on Sunday, defeated Djokovic 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in the last-eight.

366.title: 'Waited over 1hr for wheelchair at Delhi airport', says para swimmer; Air India replies
366.article_body: Para swimmer Shams Aalam said he had to wait for over an hour at Delhi airport to get his personal wheelchair after flying on an Air India flight. "I need to use washroom no one supporting," said Aalam on Twitter. After he got the wheelchair, Air India tweeted, "It took some time...as it got delayed due to airport security reasons."

367.title: Man ends life after losing borrowed ₹17,000 in online game in MP
367.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore died by suicide after he lost borrowed ₹17,000 in an online ludo game. The man, Basant Devidas Gavale, was the only son in the family and left a suicide note in which he wrote, "Whatever I am doing, I am doing it voluntarily." Gavale had asked his boss for the money.

368.title: 40-yr-old priest found dead in temple in Raj, idol missing
368.article_body: A 40-year-old priest was found dead and the idol of a deity was reported missing from inside a temple in Rajasthan's Bundi, police said on Tuesday. It is likely that the priest was killed while protecting the idol, said Additional Superintendent of Police (Bundi) Kishori Lal. It is believed that there were two or more attackers, SP Jai Yadav said.

369.title: Sri Lanka to get $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers
369.article_body: A Sri Lankan official on Tuesday said that Sri Lanka will take a $55 million loan from India to buy fertilisers. The country is currently dealing with a severe economic crisis that has sparked a rise in food prices and also caused food shortages. The decision has been taken ahead of the 'Maha' harvest season in the country.

370.title: Big B liked idea of ancient astras in modern world: Brahmāstra director
370.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji has stated that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has always liked the idea of ancient Indian astras in the modern world. The director added, "Mr Bachchan...told me that the concept will work with people." Ayan further said that whoever was approached for the film came on board, be it Alia Bhatt, Nagarjuna Akkineni or Amitabh Bachchan.

371.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for 3 bomb blasts in Manipur's Imphal
371.article_body: Police said a 46-year-old man, Thounaojam Rishi Luwangcha, was arrested in connection with three low-intensity blasts in and around Manipur's Imphal in recent weeks. Imphal West District Superintendent of Police (SP) Ksh Shivakanta Singh said explosives, detonators and cordtex wires were seized from him. Luwangcha said he was paid ₹30,000 for each blast by an armed group, police added.

372.title: Jealous of son, people congratulating me for him not 'Rocketry': Madhavan
372.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has said in an interview that he is "really jealous" of his son Vedaant right now. The actor added, "Every time I meet people...I think that they are coming up to me with a smile because I think they are congratulating me for 'Rocketry' but then they say, 'He not really got the silver but gold'."

373.title: Always nice to play in India against India: SA batter Miller
373.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller said his side are aware that the upcoming five-match T20I series against India will be a challenging one as the hosts have serious match-winners in their team. "It's always nice to play in India against India. Hopefully...we can beat team," he added. The first T20I will be played in Delhi on June 9.

374.title: Man shares pic of fish caught in Russia, Instagram user says 'Looks like a Pokémon'
374.article_body: A deep-sea fisherman shared an image of a creature dubbed 'Frankenstein's fish'. It was shared by Roman Fedortsov, a trawlerman stationed near port city of Murmansk, Russia. The picture shows a translucent white fish, with sunken green eyes and fins that look like torn wings. "Looks like a Pokémon," a comment read while another person wrote, "It...looks like anime eyes."

375.title: 21-yr-old Suved Parkar records 5th highest score on debut in first-class cricket history
375.article_body: Mumbai's 21-year-old middle-order batter Suved Parkar recorded the fifth-highest score on debut in first-class cricket history. Parkar scored 252(447) in the first innings of his team's Ranji Trophy quarter-final against Uttarakhand. Bihar's Sakibul Gani holds the record for the highest score on first-class debut with 341, followed by Ajay Rohera (267*), Amol Muzumdar (260) and Bahir Shah (256*).

376.title: I've practically grown up in BJP, accept & respect its decision: Nupur on suspension
376.article_body: BJP's former National Spokesperson Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from BJP over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad, said she 'respects and accepts' the party's decision. "I have practically grown up in the organisation," said Sharma. At least 15 nations have condemned the remarks with some seeking a public apology over remarks by Sharma and another ex-BJP leader Naveen Jindal.

377.title: I didn't want to enter films, wanted job with regular pay: Kajol
377.article_body: Actress Kajol has revealed that she had never wanted to join the film industry. The actress said, "I always wanted a job that would give me a regular pay cheque every month. That's the kind of job I had wanted." In an earlier interview, Kajol had said that she didn't think the money in films was worth the effort.

378.title: 28-yr-old man kills father after an argument in J&K, arrested
378.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man murdered his father after an argument in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district. Accused Joginder Kumar attacked his father in his sleep with a hammer, a police official said, adding that the victim died on the spot. A police team rushed to the spot on getting information and arrested the accused, the official said.

379.title: Focus on building organisation first: Nadda to Andhra BJP leaders
379.article_body: Addressing BJP leaders in Andhra Pradesh, party National President JP Nadda asked the leaders to first focus on building the organisation from the ground level in the state rather than worrying about political alliances. "Remember, we have BJP governments in 18 states, apart from the Centre...We have a strategy for Andhra Pradesh and will do whatever is required," Nadda said.

380.title: Kerala CM, his wife & daughter involved in gold smuggling: Main accused Swapna Suresh
380.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, on Tuesday claimed CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife Kamala and daughter Veena were involved in the scam. Suresh further said Vijayan's additional private secretary CM Raveendran, then Principal Secretary Nalini Netto and then minister KT Jaleel were also involved. "I've filed a petition seeking protection in the court," she added.

381.title: Kanpur DM Neha Sharma transferred days after violence, Vishak Iyer to replace her
381.article_body: Kanpur Nagar District Magistrate Neha Sharma has been transferred to Local Bodies Department of Uttar Pradesh, days after violence broke out in the district. She will be replaced by CMO Special Secretary Vishak G Iyer. The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday announced the transfer of a total of 21 IAS officers. Last month, the state government transferred 16 IAS officers.

382.title: Magic show held for Rajasthan Cong MLAs in resort ahead of RS polls
382.article_body: A magic show was organised for Rajasthan Congress MLAs who are staying in a resort amid poaching fears ahead of the June 10 Rajya Sabha polls. Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot was also present there during the show held on Monday. The Congress had shifted its legislators to Udaipur on June 2.

383.title: UK seeks probe into alleged Ukraine grain theft by Russia amid war
383.article_body: UK's Farming Minister Victoria Prentis on Tuesday called for an immediate investigation into allegations that Russia has been stealing grain from Ukraine. Prentis, who termed the allegations 'very serious', said that she has heard reports of grain theft in southern Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine is unable to export wheat supplies due to the Russian blockade of its Black Sea ports.

384.title: We'd want to get best out of Hardik's skills: Dravid ahead of T20Is vs SA
384.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said the side would want to get the best out of all-rounder Hardik Pandya's batting, bowling and fielding skills ahead of five-match T20I series against South Africa. "Hardik's leadership was impressive right through the IPL," he added. Hardik-led GT won IPL 2022 title in their debut season. First T20I to be played on Thursday.

385.title: Ricky Kej's Grammy medallion, stuck in Bengaluru customs, cleared after 2 months
385.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian composer Ricky Kej sought the help of authorities to expedite the clearance of his Grammy medallion. Kej claimed it was stuck with customs department in Bengaluru for over two months. A few hours later, he tweeted, "Thanks to the quick, swift intervention by the Customs of India, my medallion has cleared customs and will be delivered tomorrow."

386.title: Apple to change iPhone connector as EU agrees to single charging port
386.article_body: Apple will have to change the connector on iPhones sold in Europe by 2024 after EU countries on Tuesday agreed to a single mobile charging port for mobile phones, tablets and cameras. European Commission said the decision would make consumers' lives easier and help them save money. "By autumn 2024, USB Type-C will become the common charging port," EU said.

387.title: Who are UP-born billionaire Gupta brothers arrested in UAE on corruption charges?
387.article_body: Rajesh Gupta and Atul Gupta of the wealthy Gupta family were arrested in Dubai on Tuesday for corruption in South Africa. The UP-born brothers had multiple businesses in South Africa including IT, media, mining etc. They enjoyed close ties with former South African President Jacob Zuma and allegedly benefited financially from them. They're also accused of fraud and money laundering.

388.title: Frustrated & angry: Biocon chief on poor condition of B'luru roads
388.article_body: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw recently said she was "frustrated and angry at the lack of responsibility of the MLA, Panchayat and MP of Bengaluru's Anekal taluk and Huskur Gram Panchayat at the Huskur-Sarjapur road's abominable condition". "Why does the government build bus depot and quarters with no road to support it? Shame on all the local politicians," Kiran added.

389.title: Teacher, 22-yr-old student held for molesting minor boys in Kerala
389.article_body: A teacher and a 22-year-old student of an institution, imparting religious education in Kerala's Kannur, have been arrested in a POCSO case for allegedly molesting three minor boys, who went there for religious studies. The parents got to know about the incident when the kids refused to go to school after vacations, an officer said.

390.title: German Foreign Minister tests +ve for COVID during trip to Pakistan
390.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus during her trip to Pakistan. Baerbock took a COVID-19 test after she noticed that she had lost her sense of taste during lunch today, the German Foreign Ministry said. Notably, Baerbock had met Pakistan's Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari earlier in the day.

391.title: Didn't care on tying, don't care now when I'm 2 up: Nadal on Grand Slam race
391.article_body: Commenting on who will end up with most Grand Slams following his 22nd Slam at French Open 2022, which has put him two clear of Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal stated anything can happen. "I didn't care when we were tied and I don't care now when I'm two up. I just want to keep competing," he added.

392.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 2.9%, warns of stagflation
392.article_body: World Bank on Tuesday cut its global growth forecast for 2022 by 1.2 percentage points to 2.9% and warned of stagflation. It said the Russia-Ukraine war has compounded damage from COVID-19 pandemic, with many countries likely to face recession. World Bank President David Malpass said such a period of weak growth and high inflation was last seen in the 1970s.

393.title: YSRCP hires I-PAC again ahead of 2024 Andhra Assembly polls
393.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's ruling YSRCP has hired political strategist Prashant Kishor's Indian Political Action Committee (I-PAC) for a second time ahead of 2024 state Assembly polls, a party leader has confirmed. "Kishor's colleague...Rishi Raj Singh [along with I-PAC's team] will be working for...YSRCP till...next elections," the leader added. YSRCP won 151 out of 175 seats in 2019 state Assembly polls.

394.title: Govt working at grassroots level for welfare of tribal society: Shah
394.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that the government is working at the grassroots level for the welfare of tribal society. After inaugurating the National Tribal Research Institute in Delhi, Shah said that the NTRI will work to realise PM Narendra Modi's vision of "connecting the diversity of tribal societies and other tribal institutions running across the country."

395.title: No batter likes to face 150 kmph ball: Bavuma on facing Umran ahead of T20Is
395.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa T20I series, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma praised Umran Malik, saying he's an "exciting pace bowling prospect" for Team India. Talking about possibly facing Umran, who consistently bowled over 150 kmph in the recently concluded IPL 2022, Bavuma said no batter wants to face a ball at 150 kmph. First T20I will be played on Thursday.

396.title: Mumbai's daily COVID-19 cases rise to 1,242, positivity rate at 7.24%
396.article_body: Mumbai on Tuesday reported 1,242 fresh COVID-19 cases, compared to 676 cases recorded on Monday. The city saw 506 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stands at 5,974. The positivity rate dropped to 7.24% from Monday's 9.8%. As many as 74 patients were hospitalised on Tuesday.

397.title: Govt widens CDS selection pool; serving or retd 3-star officers eligible
397.article_body: The Centre has issued three separate notifications amending the rules of Army, Navy and Air Force for the appointment of the next Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). Any serving or retired Lieutenant General, Air Marshal and Vice Admiral under the age of 62 years will be eligible for the post. The post is lying vacant since General Bipin Rawat's death.

398.title: Imran Khan's party carried out 'suicide attacks' against Pak: Ex-PM
398.article_body: Former Pakistani PM and PML(N) leader Shahid Khaqan Abbasi has accused ex-PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) of being responsible for "suicide attacks" against the country. "The decisions [PTI] made...last month...[and] the manner in which they breached the IMF deal...were...suicide attacks," Abbasi said. He also accused Khan's administration of neglecting Pakistan's energy sector.

399.title: 2 people dead after shooting in German supermarket: Police
399.article_body: Two people were found dead after a shooting in a supermarket in central Germany on Tuesday, the police said. There was no danger to the public, the police added. Witnesses reported that a man shot a woman in the supermarket and immediately afterward apparently killed himself, according to a police statement.

400.title: India's FY23 economic growth forecast cut to 7.5% by World Bank
400.article_body: The World Bank on Tuesday cut India's FY23 economic growth forecast to 7.5% from 8% estimated earlier in April. It cut the forecast due to "headwinds from rising inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical tensions offsetting buoyancy in the recovery of services consumption from the pandemic". World Bank had trimmed the projection for India from 8.7% to 8% in April.

401.title: Govt proposes panel to override decisions of social media firms in new draft IT rules
401.article_body: In a new draft of its Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines & Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021, the government has proposed a committee with powers to override the decisions of all social media companies. The proposed Grievance Appellate Committee will be able to veto the decisions of grievance officers of intermediaries. The government will hold public consultations in mid-June.
